website_summaries.verdict: Direct, clear, and to-the-point instruction that, despite somewhat lacking practice questions, make this guide a must-have for PMP prep.
pros: Easy to follow, with concepts and topics explained so they’re easy to grasp
Practice questions are in line with PMP exam’s questions
cons: PMP exam questions are much more difficult than the practice questions in this guide
Numerous spelling errors throughout the guide

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, don’t regret one bit
customer_reviews.text: I will credit this book for passing me on the PMP. I have my masters in PJM, attended a 35 hour boot camp in person, and took the test. I failed by a few questions as you can see above. I purchased this book, read it cover to cover twice. I read roughly 1-2 chapters a night and completed the quizzes. I took a week break inbetween and then did the 200question read. I memorized the IPECC ISSCQRCRPS chart and formulas. After that I scored much higher and as you can see. Listen to the books tips, read it, and take the PMp with confidence. Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: A & S Smith

customer_reviews.title: Author makes the concepts easy and focuses on everything you need to know
customer_reviews.text: Studied with this book for about 3 weeks and took the exam, passed on the first try. Author makes the concepts easy and focuses on everything you need to know, I didn't use anything other than this book. Price was only 68 when I purchased, not sure if its worth it for nearly 100 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: warf

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally started studying with a different book and wasted a few of my limited available study weeks, so by the time I found this one I didn’t have a ton of confidence that I’d pass. Not only did I pass on the first try, I far outpaced the minimum requirements, and I credit that to this book. I found the practice test and chapter questions were much more challenging than the actual test, so by the time I took it the questions were a breeze. I handed the book off to a coworker who is planning to take the test and I believe it will be as useful for her as it was for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth It
customer_reviews.text: This book is not for me; Cons: 1. The text literally covers only half page rest half is for adding your notes: why so much less content 2. Most of times many content/saves from repeating same but refers back to the previous sections is too annoying 3. Due to less content in pages, it lacks the grip to read the materials 4. When you filp through the pages - so much of space is wasted and so little content... repeating from 1 as it left with no impressoin to read this book. Wasted the money.. better off with PMBOK.
customer_reviews.author: infocreep

customer_reviews.title: Great book. I had taken the classes required to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book. I had taken the classes required to qualify for the PMP but I would not have passed if it hadn't been for this book. I studied for 4 weeks and was able to pass the exam on my first try!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Andy Crowe is the REAL MVP!! Passed on 1st try!
customer_reviews.text: This was such as awesome resource! I read it cover to cover ... when it suggested I first review the PMBOk I did and then came back to it. I watched all the videos (really great supplemental explaination) and even listened to Manage This! podcast (I didnt connect the dots until we’ll after I started listening that one of the hosts was the author of the book I’d started reviewing) I passed (above target 😋 ) on my try - just as promised. There’s no way I’d have perform as well with out Andy’s insights. Great study guide!
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Easy and interesting reading
customer_reviews.text: After taking a class which recommended reading large swaths of the PMBOK between sessions, the material just wasn’t clicking for me, and I realized I had a lot of self-study to do. Luckily I found Andy’s book, and it was like a breath of fresh air. Read it from cover to cover without a problem. He uses plain language that makes the subject interesting and always brings the point back to passing the exam. This book was the foundation of my project management knowledge. With the sample questions contained here, some additional content I paid for on the Velociteach site, and question books from other sources, I did pass on the first try. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chad McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Passed my PMP on the 1st try!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic reference book when studying for the PMP. Andy does a great job of breaking down the concepts and explaining them in was that sticks. Passing the PMP exam is about understanding and applying the material, not memorizing it. This book guides you to that understanding in language that is far easier to understand then the PMBOK, which reads a bit like stereo instructions IMHO. There is also a video that goes along with each section giving it a bit of an instructor led feel. If you are planning on sitting for your PMP I would highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marois

customer_reviews.title: Today I passed the PMP exam first try
customer_reviews.text: I used this book only as my main studying source with the pmbok guide as a reference I also took the 3 monthes course on the velociteach websiteand I can tell that andy through the explanation in the chapters of the book and the practice questions provided in the book put me into the mind set I needed to pass the exam from the first try.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST BOOK YOU CAN BUY
customer_reviews.text: Passed my PMP today on the first try. Used every second of the exam but passed. I can say without a doubt this book positioned me to pass the exam. It pushed hard for the person to understand the ITTO not from a memorization point of view but from a workflow perspective. The questions "I think" are harder than the actual exam which is great as it positioned me for the exam.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Get this book and study!  Boom...be a PMP!
customer_reviews.text: Used this book exclusively to study along with a 35 PDU course I took through Udemy but most of my time was in this! Awesome study guide and did pass the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Condon (tcondon@yahoo.com)

customer_reviews.title: Got me through the PMP - Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Found this the most readable of the 3 PMP prep books that I purchased (this one, Head First, Rita's ). This book along with practice exams on PM Training were my primary study content. Concise and on point; written to prepare for the exam. Not very useful as a general reference, but a good study tool. I recommend taking the practice exams at the end of the chapter prior to reading that chapter and again afterword. Best of luck with your studies.
customer_reviews.author: ComeAgain?

customer_reviews.title: This is all  you need
customer_reviews.text: I passed with "above target" in all areas on the first try. This book prepared me very well for the exam and was really easy to read and comprehend. Maybe it was the test I received but I do not even feel I was tested on half the material I learned in this book and it was significantly less than if I tried to review and learn the entire PMBOK. Totally unnecessary. Trust the book, trust the process. I'm happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money! Absolutely worthless. Took the PMI course and that was great, this book is only good for starting fire. DO NOT waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Double D

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to pass the PMP on the first try
customer_reviews.text: This book, along with some free online materials and test questions, is all it took for me to pass the PMP. From application approval > passing the test was just over 5 weeks. I would highly recommend purchasing this!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa C.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good for Site Based Sit-Down Exams
customer_reviews.text: Overall the book is really good and will help anyone attempting to take the exam. However, please note for any of those taking the exam in these days and times via the online proctored examination option, this book is not best for that. I used this book to prepare for that exam and did not pass as again it caters to the information and strategies required for an on-site sit-down exam.
customer_reviews.author: Mister EGS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent study guide
customer_reviews.text: I used this book as my sole resource for the PMP exam. Studied for 3 weeks, scored an 82% on the 200 question exam at the back of the book. Passed the PMP exam with “Above Target” in all process groups. Crowe’s text is concise and accurate. I even felt that his questions were more difficult than the actual exam.
customer_reviews.author: David Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Passed on the first try
customer_reviews.text: I had a few resources to prepare for the PMP exam, but this was the best. Not only does it prepare you with the material on the exam, but also how to take the exam which is equally important. The questions are not straight forward... there is a strategy for taking this exam and this book covers that.
customer_reviews.author: T Brooks

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay
customer_reviews.text: While this book is helpful with their practice questions, it really gets lost in the detail and information overload that is studying for the PMP. It's sorely missing the high level basics that allow the mind understand the crux and flow of the processes. The best resource for me BY FAR was Dan Ryan's workbooks and weekend bootcamp at the PM Exam Coach. That along with the PM Prep Cast Exam Simulator, worth every single penny!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good study source; need better mock exam questions
customer_reviews.text: Great product for studying. The layout is easy to follow and he gives needed clarity on many of the ITTOs, very different from the PMBOK. My only concern is the way he asks some of the mock exam questions. They are not clearly understood his logic for the correct answers. I will need to search for other mock exam resources to get a better idea of the questions.
customer_reviews.author: Blue62topaz

customer_reviews.title: Not good for passing the test
customer_reviews.text: So I read this book cover to cover for a month and I took the test, FAILED! This is a good book to get the fundamentals, but it doesnt teach you much when it comes to scenario questions (which is the actual PMP exam type questions)
customer_reviews.author: Adel

customer_reviews.title: This is ALL YOU NEED!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad Andy Crowe was recommended to me. The book is not as dry as the PMP and I like his short videos before every section. I found the questions to be harder than the test. I passed the PMP last month using this book. Yes, I had other tools, but I made sure I was able to pass every chapter with an 80 or above.
customer_reviews.author: Yolo

customer_reviews.title: The Title of this book should be How NOT TO PASS on Your First Try.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book based on the excellent reviews. After studying this book daily for over six months, I finally realized that I am not ready to take/pass the exam. I picked up another PMP book and after reading only 2 chapters I realized that so many critical info and topics are missing from Mr. Andy Crowe’s Textbook. This book hardly covers the materials you need to pass the exam.
customer_reviews.author: Cypher512

customer_reviews.title: Passed on 1st try!
customer_reviews.text: This is it! I passed on my first try! I read the book 4 times!!! I took the boot camp from velociteach, I also listened to the audio (conversations). The boot camp from this company included practice test, I practiced those as well. Basically I followed their complete program package and passed! Praise God ☺️!
customer_reviews.author: roxanne ledesma

customer_reviews.title: Passed PMP on the 1st try
customer_reviews.text: This book along with the PMBOk and a few Kindle readings helped me pass on my 1st try. Crowe takes the PMBOK and breaks it down to a more understandable level. He tells you what you need to know and takes out all the fluff. His final exam is very helpful which test your knowledge and points out gaps you may have. I studied for 2 months, devoting longer hours on the weekend.
customer_reviews.author: meka

customer_reviews.title: Passed the PMI on my first try
customer_reviews.text: It served its purpose. Great preparation material for PMP if you take it seriously and you also read the PMBOK
customer_reviews.author: Marco Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Missing key code
customer_reviews.text: We just received our book and there is a disclaimer near the back that states that if we are missing a key code, then the book is inauthentic. We can see where the key code was located, but it is most definitely missing. This was purchased as a new book.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Lyerly

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helped me pass on the first try
customer_reviews.text: Of the 100 hours I studied after attending boot camp, I spent 25 hours in this book. Went cover to cover and took the practice exam in the book as my last one (of five) before the actual test. Bottom line: I passed first try.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Schwalm

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY — Not Authentic!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not an authentic book! Its missing the key to the online content. Ive also found a ton of printing, grammatical and formatting errors, and oftentimes I can’t read the text. And it’s too late for me to return the book. Save yourself the time and money, and purchase the book from somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: blessedji

customer_reviews.title: Passed the PMP on my first try
customer_reviews.text: This book is pretty much essential if you plan on actually learning the PMBOK material. I read the PMBOK first and then read Andys book, Andy describes each process in easy to understand non-PMBOK jargon. At the end of each chapter, he gives specific questions on the chapter that really help comprehension too. It was actually interesting to read Andys book compared to the gut-wrenching jargon in the PMBOK. Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Pray

customer_reviews.title: Passed The Exam on 1st try ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is excellent. I had taken a very good prep course, but it only got me so far ... I needed something else, and this book got me across the finish line. I read it cover to cover twice, took all of the practice tests twice including the 200-question exam included in the book, and it prepared me perfectly for the exam, which I passed scoring "above target" in every category. This is definitely the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shavin Duffy

customer_reviews.title: Solid Fundamentals, Weak Exam Prep
customer_reviews.text: Tested and passed the PMP exam on 10-17-18. This book was easier to read than the PMBOK. Just to let you know, the actual exam was nothing like any of the tests in this book. The online content is very misleading. You get access to portions of the course material and zero access to online tests from Velociteach.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dreffs

customer_reviews.title: Worst explanation worst language and clarity
customer_reviews.text: I wish Amazon had option to give Zero star! This book is the worst book that I have ever read and I have no idea why other people are happy with that! After 28 years education and teaching experience, I would say this is the worst book I ever read. If you really want to pass PMP, stay away from this book and their website.
customer_reviews.author: Amir Tabesh

customer_reviews.title: not satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: not up to my expectations,some mistakes and not everything is based on the 6th edition! disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: guan

customer_reviews.title: I passed!
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared. This is 700ish pages, but each one is worth it! Pay close attention to what it says because it stays fairly close to the test (at least until the test changes in mid-2020). Give yourself at least 5-6 months to go through everything thoroughly. The test itself was difficult, but as the book claims, I passed on the first try!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J Stone

customer_reviews.title: Passed on my first try
customer_reviews.text: I used this book to prepare for the PMP exam without ever reading the PMBOK guide. However, i did use exam simulators from different sources, but this book is mainly what gave me the foundation in understanding the process and concepts in the project management framework. I would definitely recommend it to anybody that's looking to take the PMP exam.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: So far this book has been a great read and isn't as dry as trying to read the PMBOK. Even has a lot of information that is on the test that isn't included in the PMBOK
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Wright

customer_reviews.title: Passed on First Try!
customer_reviews.text: I really worked out of this book/took notes directly in the margins and also took PMP prep-training via PMTraining (counts toward required 35hrs)....with these combined I scored above target in each category on the first try. Would highly recommend this book and Bob Vuolo from PMTraining to pass the exam. Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: Sarina

customer_reviews.title: It Delivers!
customer_reviews.text: I studied the PMBOK guide for my first exam attempt and failed miserably. I bought this book along with the practice tests and not only passed, I scored above target!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sufficient enough to clear PMP
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Book describes concepts in precise, clear, and in bullet format if you are intimidated by PMP official guide. this is a good to get started. cons: Not sufficient enough to clear the PMP exam the main motive. one will need to go through the guide for more fine details that are asked in the exam I found the questions are a bit easy than the Rita PMP book but tougher than headfirst PMP.
customer_reviews.author: psu vikings

customer_reviews.title: Passed on the first try with above target in ALL categories!  Buy this book!
customer_reviews.text: This book is awesome. It explains everything you need to know in a context that’s easy to follow and remember. I passed on the first try with above target in all categories! I took a boot camp that cost quite a bit of money and without this book I would not have passed.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Passed on first attempt!
customer_reviews.text: Great resource, this really was the difference that helped me to pass! I cleared the exam with two AT and three T. Read this cover to cover twice and used the PMBOK to clarify some additional concepts.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!!!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine recommended this book. I gave it a shot and let me tell you, the book works wonders. Andy eliminates alot of extra fluff and focuses on the exam favorites. The book is easy to read and very simple to understand. Before you read the book, please do not have the expectation that this book is going to consist of an overwhelming amount of material because it's not. It's straightforward, right to the point. The best book I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and digest, would reccomend
customer_reviews.text: This book was comprehensive and easy to read. I passed the PMP on my first try, but I would reccomend using additional materials along with this book. Read through the book twice and use the practice exams.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Missing digital code
customer_reviews.text: This book, purchased new, and linked from Crowe’s Website, came without the digital code. Many others have said this in their reviews. The back cover where the code is referenced from the previous page has two sticky spots where something was clearly affixed. Someone along the distribution chain is clearly tampering with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Getchell Highland

customer_reviews.title: This was a FAKE book.  DO NOT BUY!  DOES NOT CONTAIN AN INSITE CODE FOR ONLINE QUESTIONS!!
customer_reviews.text: This was not a genuine book. It was a fake. There was no flap attached to the inside back cover with an access code to the online questions, which I now have to pay for separately. I didn't figure this out until I had finished reading the book and went to take the sample exam in the back where it instructed my to look online for more questions. I am trying to figure out how to contact Amazon to see if I can get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H.

customer_reviews.title: Key to passing
customer_reviews.text: This book was key to me passing the first try. Broke everything down to make sense and tell ya what was most important.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Z.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource
customer_reviews.text: Although I do have a certificate in project management from Cornell, I used this book exclusively when studying for the exam. I studied for about 4 weeks going through this book multiple times, and I did pass on the first try!
customer_reviews.author: Thurston Plumley

customer_reviews.title: Just like the title reads
customer_reviews.text: This was the only book I read preparing the PMP exam. I did pass on my first try!
customer_reviews.author: JS J.

customer_reviews.title: Honestly this book is so confusing
customer_reviews.text: I am a PMP exam candidate and this book is not the way I thought based on the review i read. This book made me more confused on PMP guide. If anyone thinking to buy this book i will not recommend it. This is my honest feeling and i wish i can return this back and get my refund. I wasted my time and money on this book.
customer_reviews.author: Manoj

customer_reviews.title: No Key Insight included!
customer_reviews.text: Although the book is great and I feel will be very helpful towards my exam, this version did not come with the Key Insight which authentic books should have, per page 99. Apparently the Key Insight code that is supposed to be on the inside of the back cover gives you additional online testing resources which I would really appreciate. I feel gipped.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki light

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend to prepare for PMP exam
customer_reviews.text: This book is a lifesaver, easy to understand and his approach is brilliant to teaching EVM formulas!
customer_reviews.author: Jamiefico

customer_reviews.title: Generally good, missing "activation key" for online tools
customer_reviews.text: End of chapter quizzes seem to be easier than test real life examples, and the copy I rec'd did not have the activation key in the back cover for online access to the author's site. That's disappointing b/c it was one of the main reasons I bought the book.
customer_reviews.author: J. Graham

customer_reviews.title: I passed on my first try!
customer_reviews.text: The book and videos are great. I studied for 2 weeks and passed the test.
customer_reviews.author: Houston2016

customer_reviews.title: No Key to Online Training
customer_reviews.text: I just got to the first quiz on pg 99 and read that this book comes with free access to additional content, new exam questions, and simulated PMP exams and 'if your book did not come with a Key to InSite on the inside back cover, it may not be authentic.' However, I can purchase one online. THIS BOOK DID NOT COME WITH A KEY FOR ONLINE ACCESS - BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: William C Wherritt Jr

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing for me. Perhaps if you have an ...
customer_reviews.text: Did nothing for me. Perhaps if you have an unlimited amount of time. I did not appreciate the layout etc.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Compagnoni Gibb

customer_reviews.title: I passed 1st time!
customer_reviews.text: Performed as advertised. This is the only material I used to pass the PMP exam - which I did on 1st try.
customer_reviews.author: D. H.

customer_reviews.title: Best PMP exam prep book out there
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best book to follow when preparing for the PMP exam. Lots of practice quizzes and full practice exam at the end.
customer_reviews.author: RCG

customer_reviews.title: Extra study guide!
customer_reviews.text: Still studying for the exam, I'm using the book in conjunction with the PMBOK 6th Edition. Only thing I'm not a fan of, is having to refer back to prior chapters to re-read Knowledge areas or Inputs/Tools Techniques/Outputs. I guess it forces you to remember the prior chapter information. I just thought it was distracting to have to refer back to prior chapters instead of the information being brought forward to keep reminding you.
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: Passed at above target in every category!
customer_reviews.text: Andy's book is on point for the most difficult areas in Executing and Monitoring and Controlling. Great content. There is a little card in the back with authorization codes to access more resources! I reviewed all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D. Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Great review
customer_reviews.text: Good product that was essential to passing this exam. Highly recommend this book if you are taking your PMP.
customer_reviews.author: Jamkat Heights

customer_reviews.title: NO KEY was given with this book - I was scammed!
customer_reviews.text: I am mortified that I made this purchase for what it was advertised as, which included receiving a key so I can access the website for further studies. Ladies and Gentlemen, I was scammed! An a want back mi money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Key to InSite for study questions, PMP exam guides, and study aids.
customer_reviews.text: So far seems like a great reference guide however, go to the first serious of review questions in chapter four realizing that there was no node included for the study questions and additional resources as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Must have for anyone studying for the PMP and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nailed the Concepts!
customer_reviews.text: The content is presented in a very clear and succinct manner. Concepts for each of the process groups and knowledge area reinforced with very good examples. Example questions are true to the style of the exam. Took the exam, pass my first time, and was well "Above Target".
customer_reviews.author: PMP passed

customer_reviews.title: A very good for PMP
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good and comprehensive book for PMP. I cleared PMP exam with the help of this book with above target scores in three sections. The exam at the end of the book is also very good.
customer_reviews.author: Santanu B.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with key  to get online access
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with key to onsite or any online videos as described
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Fast
customer_reviews.text: Helped me to pass, and includes key to extra practice tests!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Get this book!!!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended! Need to read PMBOK book but after that read this cover to cover. I just passed PMP exam on first try and with above target in most areas. This was without a doubt the difference maker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: simple is the best
customer_reviews.text: very concise, sharp to the point. If you only have 1 or 2 months for preparation, go with this book. If you have more time, go with this book three times.
customer_reviews.author: JLY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for individual prep
customer_reviews.text: Excellent prep book. I worked through the entire book twice and passed the PMP exam with an “Above Target” rating. I would highly recommend this book to anyone preparing for the exam on their own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has everything you need to pass.
customer_reviews.text: Taking a week off of work and studying nothing but the contents of this book I was able to pass. I would highly suggest using this as one of your exam prep resources.
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore Pitonzo

customer_reviews.title: Gets you ready for the test
customer_reviews.text: Its a good book to get you ready for the test, great example, practice questions and the content is explan in detail.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book! Really helps to streamline topics and exam focus!
customer_reviews.author: Terrance Green

customer_reviews.title: very fast shipment
customer_reviews.text: very fast shipment, but the book cover is very dirty, inside is ok, I will use it today
customer_reviews.author: shenhui wu

customer_reviews.title: Very organized book
customer_reviews.text: Really the book is meet and exceed the expectations. I enjoyed read it, studied from it and guess what , I passed from the first time because of it
customer_reviews.author: Ereny

customer_reviews.title: Good for the PDP
customer_reviews.text: I like the VIdeo links that are provided in the book.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Marose

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality paper it gives hints for exam strategy. Made the content simple. Easy to read and understand. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Alaqeily

customer_reviews.title: It easy to understans
customer_reviews.text: At first i was hesitant to spend more than 50 bucks for a review book. When i got it, its worth the price. It easy to understans. Not very technical but focused with in-depth writing. I like this book so far. I purchased it 2 days ago and now i’m on Chapter 6. Its easy ready and grear way to learn. I have the PMBOK 6th edition — this book is clearly catered to make it easy to grasp the concepts and way much better visually coz the page material in PMBOK is just weird.
customer_reviews.author: Cute Joy Rey

customer_reviews.title: Not able to find the KEY
customer_reviews.text: I received this Book and it doesn't have the KEY at. Looks like it is not original book. was not expecting this from AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: Pramod

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it to pass
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I would have passed my PMP exam on the first try without this book. My only critique is with the online practice test section. Why can't the chapter quizzes & practice exams from the book be available digitally?? Flipping pages back and forth and scribbling answers on scratch paper is obnoxious when you clearly have the system in place for great online test taking. You'd get 6 stars from me if all questions were available online.
customer_reviews.author: Audie

customer_reviews.title: This is a good book, I will recommend it to any one ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good book , I will recommend it to any one who want to pass the exam.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can this be used as a Study Guide for CAPM
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Can this also be used to study for CAPM?
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ojugbana

customer_reviews.title: You only need one book
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this book, dont bother with the PMBOK. It is also the same content I learned in a $2000 course. It is worth it to grab the quick reference guide
customer_reviews.author: Dayv

customer_reviews.title: Great Book.  Highly Recommend for Passing PMP Exam.
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Very easy to read. The author does a great job with this book. It is a must if you are looking to pass the PMP exam. I wish there were more questions with the online version provided with the book or a way to get the exam questions in the book electronically. Time consuming flipping back and forth when reviewing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing study material
customer_reviews.text: This book is awesome! Provides excellent material and points out what to really study and understand. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Burkert

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I found this and the previous version optimal for the PMP exam
customer_reviews.author: Fernando
